00001 /* prefetch-context.cpp: Context-based prefetcher, similar to markov/correlating prefetchers [Joseph and Grunwald, ISCA 1997] */
00002 /*
00003  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00004  */
00005 #define COMPONENT_NAME "context"
00006 
00007 
00008 #ifdef PREFETCH_PARSE_ARGS
00009 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00010 {
00011   int num_entries;
00012   int tag_bits;
00013   int next_bits;
00014   int conf_bits;
00015   int u_bits;
00016   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d",&num_entries,&tag_bits,&next_bits,&conf_bits,&u_bits) != 5)
00017     fatal("bad %s prefetcher options string %s (should be \"context:num_entries:tag-bits:next-bits:conf-bits:u-bits\")",cp->name,opt_string);
00018   return new prefetch_context_t(cp,num_entries,tag_bits,next_bits,conf_bits,u_bits);
00019 }
00020 #else
00021 
00022 class prefetch_context_t:public prefetch_t
00023 {
00024   protected:
00025   int num_entries;
00026   int mask;
00027 
00028   int tag_bits;
00029   int next_bits;
00030   int conf_bits;
00031   int u_bits;
00032 
00033   md_paddr_t tag_mask;
00034   md_paddr_t next_mask;
00035   int conf_max;
00036   int u_max;
00037 
00038   struct prefetch_context_table_t {
00039     md_paddr_t tag;
00040     md_paddr_t next_paddr;
00041     int conf;
00042     int u;
00043   } * table;
00044 
00045   md_paddr_t last_paddr;
00046 
00047   public:
00048 
00049   /* CREATE */
00050   prefetch_context_t(struct cache_t * arg_cp,
00051                     int arg_num_entries,
00052                     int arg_tag_bits,
00053                     int arg_next_bits,
00054                     int arg_conf_bits,
00055                     int arg_u_bits)
00056   {
00057     init();
00058 
00059     last_paddr = 0;
00060 
00061     char name[256]; /* just used for error checking macros */
00062     type = strdup("context");
00063     if(!type)
00064       fatal("couldn't calloc context-prefetch type (strdup)");
00065 
00066     cp = arg_cp;
00067     sprintf(name,"%s.%s",cp->name,type);
00068 
00069     CHECK_PPOW2(arg_num_entries);
00070     num_entries = arg_num_entries;
00071     mask = num_entries - 1;
00072 
00073     tag_bits = arg_tag_bits;
00074     next_bits = arg_next_bits;
00075     conf_bits = arg_conf_bits;
00076     u_bits = arg_u_bits;
00077 
00078     tag_mask = ((1<<tag_bits)-1) << log_base2(num_entries);
00079     next_mask = (1<<next_bits)-1;
00080     conf_max = (1<<conf_bits)-1;
00081     u_max = (1<<u_bits)-1;
00082 
00083     table = (struct prefetch_context_t::prefetch_context_table_t*) calloc(num_entries,sizeof(*table));
00084     if(!table)
00085       fatal("couldn't calloc context-prefetch table");
00086 
00087     bits = num_entries * (tag_bits + next_bits + conf_bits + u_bits);
00088   }
00089 
00090   /* DESTROY */
00091   ~prefetch_context_t()
00092   {
00093     free(table);
00094     table = NULL;
00095   }
00096 
00097   /* LOOKUP */
00098   PREFETCH_LOOKUP_HEADER
00099   {
00100     lookups++;
00101 
00102     int index = paddr & mask;
00103     md_paddr_t pf_paddr = 0;
00104 
00105     /* do current lookup first */
00106     if((paddr & tag_mask) == table[index].tag)
00107     {
00108       /* hit: check if confident */
00109       if(table[index].conf >= conf_max)
00110         pf_paddr = (paddr&~next_mask) | (table[index].conf&next_mask);
00111     }
00112 
00113     /* train */
00114     index = last_paddr & mask;
00115 
00116     /* is it a hit? */
00117     if((last_paddr&tag_mask) == table[index].tag) /* hit */
00118     {
00119       /* each hit increments the useful counter */
00120       if(table[index].u < u_max)
00121         table[index].u++;
00122 
00123       /* increase confidence if we see the same "next" address */
00124       if((paddr & next_mask) == table[index].next_paddr)
00125       {
00126         if(table[index].conf < conf_max)
00127           table[index].conf ++;
00128       }
00129       else
00130       {
00131         table[index].next_paddr = paddr & next_mask;
00132         table[index].conf = 0;
00133         if(table[index].u > 0) /* also decrease usefulness */
00134           table[index].u --;
00135       }
00136     }
00137     else /* miss */
00138     {
00139       if(table[index].u > 0)
00140       {
00141         table[index].u --;
00142       }
00143       else /* this entry hasn't been useful lately, replace it */
00144       {
00145         table[index].u = u_max;
00146         table[index].conf = 0;
00147         table[index].tag = last_paddr & tag_mask;
00148         table[index].next_paddr = paddr;
00149       }
00150     }
00151 
00152     last_paddr = paddr;
00153 
00154     return pf_paddr;
00155   }
00156 };
00157 
00158 
00159 
00160 #endif /* PREFETCH_PARSE_ARGS */
00161 #undef COMPONENT_NAME
